intro: Jaltomata dentata, commonly known as the toothed jaltomata, is a flowering plant native to the highlands of South America. It belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has hairy, glandular leaves. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, dry seeds. Jaltomata dentata is often found in cloud forests and is adapted to cool, humid climates.
